result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Luukkonen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample  (not needed - DNA already on file)

Defendant Ryan D Luukkonen in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  Defendant Ryan D Luukkonen in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is. Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Ryan D Luukkonen in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell.  Defendant Ryan D Luukkonen in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Crowell indicates defendant is willing to waive his right to a preliminary hearing today.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of judge by defendant. Court approves request.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed by next court date.

Defendant Ryan D Luukkonen in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, requests time to retain an atty or fill out form for court appointed attorney. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
